metadata.title: CVE-2022-48788 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nvme-rdma: fix possible use-after-free in transport error_recovery workWhile nvme_rdma_submit_async_event_work is checking the ctrl and queuestate before preparing the AER command and scheduling io_work, in orderto fully prevent a race where this check is not reliable the errorrecovery work must flush async_event_work before continuing to destroythe admin queue after setting the ctrl state to RESETTING such thatthere is no race .submit_async_event and the error recovery handleritself changing the ctrl state.

criterions.comment: linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
